{"step_by_step_thinking": "The mandibular fossa is a depression located on the temporal bone. It is specifically found on the inferior surface of the temporal bone, near the external auditory meatus. The mandible bone is the lower jawbone, and it articulates with the mandibular fossa to form the temporomandibular joint. The maxilla bone is the upper jawbone and does not contain the mandibular fossa. The sphenoid bone is a cranial bone located in the middle of the skull and does not contain the mandibular fossa. Therefore, the correct answer is D. Temporal bone.", "answer_choice": "D"}
